description:
This library module provides token-based string similarity functions that view strings as sets or multi-sets of tokens and use set-related properties to compute similarity scores.

The tokens correspond to groups of characters extracted from the strings being compared, such as individual words or character n-grams.

These functions are particularly useful for matching near duplicate strings in cases where typographical conventions often lead to rearrangement of words (e.g., "John Smith" versus "Smith, John").

The logic contained in this module is not specific to any particular XQuery implementation, although the module requires the trigonometic functions of XQuery 3.0 or a math extension function such as sqrt($x as numeric) for computing the square root.

functions.name: cosine-ngrams
functions.signature: ($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $n as xs:integer) as xs:double
functions.description:
Returns the cosine similarity coefficient between sets of character n-grams extracted from two strings.

The n-grams from each string are weighted according to their occurence frequency (i.e., weighted according to the term-frequency heuristic from Information Retrieval).

Example usage : 

 cosine-ngrams("DWAYNE", "DUANE", 2 )

The function invocation in the example above returns : 

 0.2401922307076307
functions.summary: Returns the cosine similarity coefficient between sets of character n-grams extracted from two strings.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The number of characters to consider when extracting n-grams.

returns.description: The cosine similarity coefficient between the sets n-grams extracted from the two strings.

functions.name: cosine-tokens
functions.signature: ($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $r as xs:string) as xs:double
functions.description:
Returns the cosine similarity coefficient between sets of tokens extracted from two strings. The tokens from each string are weighted according to their occurence frequency (i.e., weighted according to the term-frequency heuristic from Information Retrieval).

Example usage : 

 cosine-tokens("The FLWOR Foundation", "FLWOR Found.", " +" )

The function invocation in the example above returns : 

 0.408248290463863
functions.summary: Returns the cosine similarity coefficient between sets of tokens extracted from two strings.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: A regular expression forming the delimiter character(s) which mark the boundaries between adjacent tokens.

returns.description: The cosine similarity coefficient between the sets tokens extracted from the two strings.

functions.name: cosine
functions.signature: ($desc1 as xs:string*, $desc2 as xs:string*) as xs:double
functions.description:
Auxiliary function for computing the cosine similarity coefficient between strings, using stringdescriptors based on sets of character n-grams or sets of tokens extracted from two strings.

Example usage : 

 cosine( ("aa","bb") , ("bb","aa"))

The function invocation in the example above returns : 

 1.0
functions.summary: Auxiliary function for computing the cosine similarity coefficient between strings, using stringdescriptors based on sets of character n-grams or sets of tokens extracted from two strings.

parameters.name: desc1
parameters.description: The descriptor for the first string.

parameters.name: desc2
parameters.description: The descriptor for the second string.

returns.description: The cosine similarity coefficient between the descriptors for the two strings.

functions.name: dice-ngrams
functions.signature: ($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $n as xs:integer) as xs:double
functions.description:
Returns the Dice similarity coefficient between sets of character n-grams extracted from two strings.

Example usage : 

 dice-ngrams("DWAYNE", "DUANE", 2 )

The function invocation in the example above returns : 

 0.4615384615384616
functions.summary: Returns the Dice similarity coefficient between sets of character n-grams extracted from two strings.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The number of characters to consider when extracting n-grams.

returns.description: The Dice similarity coefficient between the sets of character n-grams extracted from the two strings.

functions.signature: ($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $r as xs:string) as xs:double
functions.description:
Returns the Dice similarity coefficient between sets of tokens extracted from two strings.

Example usage : 

 dice-tokens("The FLWOR Foundation", "FLWOR Found.", " +" )

The function invocation in the example above returns : 

 0.4
functions.summary: Returns the Dice similarity coefficient between sets of tokens extracted from two strings.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: A regular expression forming the delimiter character(s) which mark the boundaries between adjacent tokens.

returns.description: The Dice similarity coefficient between the sets tokens extracted from the two strings.

Returns the Jaccard similarity coefficient between sets of character n-grams extracted from two strings.

Example usage :

The function invocation in the example above returns :

parameters.name: n

functions.name: jaccard-tokens
functions.signature: ($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $r as xs:string) as xs:double
functions.description:
Returns the Jaccard similarity coefficient between sets of tokens extracted from two strings.

Example usage : 

 jaccard-tokens("The FLWOR Foundation", "FLWOR Found.", " +" )

The function invocation in the example above returns : 

 0.25
functions.summary: Returns the Jaccard similarity coefficient between sets of tokens extracted from two strings.

parameters.name: r
parameters.description: A regular expression forming the delimiter character(s) which mark the boundaries between adjacent tokens.

returns.description: The Jaccard similarity coefficient between the sets tokens extracted from the two strings.

functions.name: ngrams
functions.signature: ($s as xs:string, $n as xs:integer) as xs:string*
functions.description:
Returns the individual character n-grams forming a string.

Example usage : 

 ngrams("FLWOR", 2 )

The function invocation in the example above returns : 

 ("_F" , "FL" , "LW" , "WO" , "LW" , "WO" , "OR" , "R_")
functions.summary: Returns the individual character n-grams forming a string.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The number of characters to consider when extracting n-grams.

returns.description: The sequence of strings with the extracted n-grams.

functions.name: overlap-ngrams
functions.signature: ($s1 as xs:string, $s2 as xs:string, $n as xs:integer) as xs:double
functions.description:
Returns the overlap similarity coefficient between sets of character n-grams extracted from two strings.

The function invocation in the example above returns : 

 0.5
functions.summary: Returns the overlap similarity coefficient between sets of character n-grams extracted from two strings.

parameters.name: n
parameters.description: The number of characters to consider when extracting n-grams.

returns.description: The overlap similarity coefficient between the sets of character n-grams extracted from the two strings.
